fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

IP Allowlist enabled JSM Cloud’s customer signup email link is returning 401 error below:
 There was a problem accessing this content
 Encountered a 401 - Unauthorized error while loading this page.
 !1.png|width=498,height=201!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable IP allowlisting and allow your IP address
 # Create new JSM Classic project
 # At “Project settings” > “Customer permissions”, ensure service project access is set to “Anyone on the web”
 !image-2021-05-18-12-50-35-425.png|width=462,height=275!
 # In a different browser and signed off to any Atlassian account, access the portal page at https://<sitename>/servicedesk/customer/portal/1
 # Click on signup and type in a customer email address
 # Go to the customer email inbox and click on email sent from Atlassian, and click on “Sign Up” button.

h3. Expected Results

It is expected the signup link will direct to the signup page.
h3. Actual Results

Request URL below is returning 401 Unauthorized: [https://ysakai.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/complete-signup?jwt=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJxc2giOiJjYzczNjQ0YTcwMTJlYWIyYjgzZTEwNWZmZDVjZWJmY2VmMzYwNGFlMTlkNDI0M2I4MTUwOWMzOGM4MzA0YzU2IiwiaXNzIjoic2VydmljZWRlc2stand0LXRva2VuLWlzc3VlciIsImNvbnRleHQiOnsidXNlciI6IjEwMDE4IiwiZXhwaXJ5IjoiMTYyMTkwOTk5OCIsInBvcnRhbElkIjoiMSJ9LCJleHAiOjE2MzY4NTcxOTgsImlhdCI6MTYyMTMwNTE5OH0.QqIRyRMRG6tyqhMWlBBvzvFZ0bsCFDjjymc_WPqqm4M]

!1.png|width=498,height=201!
h3. Workaround

1st Workaround) Migrating the customer email to Atlassian account allows the customer to access the portal page, but is tedious for admins and not all customers will need their own atlassian accounts.  !image-2021-05-18-12-52-04-685.png|width=566,height=252!

2nd Workaround) When using IP Allowlisting, disable public signup entirely. Do not use "Anyone on the web", instead use "Customers added by agents and admins" and add customers on each project. 

!image-2021-05-18-12-52-34-744.png|width=512,height=173!
fields.summary: IP Allowlist enabled JSM Cloud’s customer signup email link is returning 401 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is unable to take site export. In the UI the receive Export error. Database shows the following task:
{code:java}
Cloud Export task	Running export (blocking) migration task: Fix fileattachment size on export to server{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unknown at this time. Issue appears similar to JSDCLOUD-8638
 Based on the tables impacted, SLA may be the related component that resulted in the error.
h3. Expected Results

The user should be able to take export especially when a backup is required for site import functionality
h3. Actual Results

The user is unable to take a site backup. The following error appears in the logs:
{code:java}
Export failed (preparation)","stack":"com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.ExportException: Export failed (preparation)
\tat com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.CloudExportTaskRunner.export(CloudExportTaskRunner.java:282)
\tat com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.CloudExportTaskRunner.lambda$runTaskAndStartZip$2(CloudExportTaskRunner.java:189)
\tat com.atlassian.connpool.impl.AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(AbstractConnectionPoolProvider.java:185)
\tat com.atlassian.jira.connpool.JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(JiraViburConnectionPoolProvider.java:164)
\tat com.atlassian.connpool.api.ConnectionPoolProvider.withPrivatePool(ConnectionPoolProvider.java:55)
\tat com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$null$0(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:64)
\tat java.util.Optional.map(Optional.java:215)
\tat com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.AbstractBackupTaskRunner.lambda$runWithSeparateContextAsync$1(AbstractBackupTaskRunner.java:63)
\tat java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture$AsyncSupply.run(CompletableFuture.java:1604)
\tat java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
\tat java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
\tat java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.ExportException: Pre export changes failed
\tat com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.PreExportTasks.prepareForExport(PreExportTasks.java:63)
\tat com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.CloudExportTaskRunner.export(CloudExportTaskRunner.java:246)
\t... 11 more
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to prepare JSD Rolex data for export
\tat com.atlassian.jira.jsd.rolex.JsdRolexExportCleanser.prepareForExport(JsdRolexExportCleanser.java:43)
\tat com.atlassian.jira.util.ThrowableFunctions.lambda$uncheckConsumer$0(ThrowableFunctions.java:80)
\tat com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList.forEach(ImmutableList.java:406)
\tat com.atlassian.jira.bc.export.PreExportTasks.prepareForExport(PreExportTasks.java:61)
{code}
And:
{code:java}
Suppressed: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint \"AO_54307E_METRICCONDITION_pkey\"
  Detail: Key (\"ID\")=(6) already exists.
...
Caused by: java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Batch entry 6 insert into \"public\".\"AO_54307E_METRICCONDITION\" (\"ID\", \"PLUGIN_KEY\", \"FACTORY_KEY\", \"CONDITION_ID\", \"TYPE_NAME\", \"TIME_METRIC_ID\")
values (6, 'com.atlassian.servicedesk', 'issue-created-sla-condition-factory', 'issue-created-hit-condition', 'Start', 3) was aborted: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint \"AO_54307E_METRICCONDITION_pkey\"
  Detail: Key (\"ID\")=(6) already exists.  Call getNextException to see other errors in the batch.
{code}
{code:java}
Caught BatchUpdateException for insert into \"public\".\"AO_7A2604_WORKINGTIME\" (\"ID\", \"CALENDAR_ID\", \"DAY\", \"START_TIME\", \"END_TIME\", \"DISABLED\")
values (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)","stack":"com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught BatchUpdateException for insert into \"public\".\"AO_7A2604_WORKINGTIME\" (\"ID\", \"CALENDAR_ID\", \"DAY\", \"START_TIME\", \"END_TIME\", \"DISABLED\")
values (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
...
Suppressed: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint \"AO_7A2604_WORKINGTIME_pkey\"
  Detail: Key (\"ID\")=(2) already exists.
...
Caused by: [CIRCULAR REFERENCE: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint \"AO_7A2604_WORKINGTIME_pkey\"
  Detail: Key (\"ID\")=(2) already exists.]
{code}
h3. Workaround

Make sure SLAs in your JSM projects are associated with the correct calendar entities.
fields.summary: Export error prevents user from taking site backup of Jira Service Management Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The shortcuts feature doesn't work as expected on the ITSM template.

In the other JSM templates, when you add a shortcut, the agents can see it on the sidebar as expected. On the ITSM, the shortcut isn't shown for the agents.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or go to an ITSM template project;
 # As a project admin, create a shortcut;
 # Agents aren't able to see that shortcut.

h3. Expected Results
The shortcuts are only available for project administrators.

h3. Actual Results
Agents should be able to see the shortcuts.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Shortcuts don't show up for Agents in an ITSM project
Allow create issue from email with image when user doesn't have create attachment permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Customer Portal, we should have side-by-side portal groups rather than one by one when we have multiple portal groups created.
h3. Suggested Solution

There should be a similar layout for portal groups as we have for the ServiceDesk projects list as shown below:
 !image-2021-05-17-16-07-48-642.png|width=122,height=80!
h3. Why this is important:

If there would be a column view for portal groups then it would be helpful for those ServiceDesks where we have many portal groups created. Instead of having one in a row, the group view is more user-friendly.
fields.summary: change the layout of how the portal groups are shown in the Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, when user click the reference data in the object Activity, it doesn't redirect to the reference object , but it remain at the same page. 

h3. Suggestion
Redirect to reference object page when user click the reference data in the object

h3. Workaround
Click from the object "Details" section
fields.summary: At Insight Object Activity section, clicking the reference data for reference object attribute will redirect to the reference object
Add information about "Service Desk Agent" permission is needed to link confluence page to service project..

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a portal has a lot of groups and a user opens a portal group that has several *Request Types* that exceeds the window height, the user won't be redirected back to the top of the page having to scroll up back to the top.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create ten portal groups
 # Add at least ten request types to a group (this will be enough to exceed the window height in any situation)
 # Move this group with the request types to the bottom of the portal groups
 # Access the portal and open the group with ten requests types

h3. Expected Results

The user should be sent back to the top of the page
h3. Actual Results

The user will keep at the bottom or sometimes in the middle of the page with the requests types needing to scroll up back to the top.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Opening a group with a large number of request types doesn't send the user back to the top of the page

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary: This request was made on behalf of my customer [amerisave.atlassian.net|http://amerisave.atlassian.net/]

JSD automation and integration with live chat

Limiting the # of live chat clients that could be integrated. -could not integrate (need the transcripts in the tickets) 

 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Right now we have to keep our live chat separate but that is not at all ideal.
fields.summary: JSD automation and integration with live chat

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing the bulk transition through the queue, the fields of the first issue will be passed on to the other selected issues if the transition has a screen associated with it.

Changes made during the transition screen will affect all selected issues, currently, there isn't an option to not edit the fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From the queue, select some issues to perform a bulk transition;
 # Click on Transition, select the transition and click on next;  
 # If the transition has a screen containing fields (Description, Assignee, Priority, etc), you will be prompted to update the tickets.

[Video example|https://share.getcloudapp.com/Z4uoXzJL]

h3. Expected Results
You can choose if the fields need to be updated, same behavior as the bulk operations from the filter screen.

h3. Actual Results
The changes are made to all tickets.

h3. Workaround
Perform the bulk transition through the Advanced Search section.

If possible, remove the screen from the transition.
fields.summary: Fields will be overwritten when bulk transitioning issues from the queue if the transition has a screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Insight object Icons are broken for unlicensed users on the customer portal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Confiogure and add an Insight custom field on a JSM request type 
# Browse the Insight custom field from the customer portal as an unlicensed user

h3. Expected Results
The objects appear in the list with the Icons 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The objects can be browsed however the Icons appear as a broken image
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Insight object Icons are broken for unlicensed users on the customer portal

fields.description:
Hi there,

Being able to view who is looking at records is fairly standard functionality in other ITSMs.

Jira Software and Service Management can do this via the 'Who's Looking' app but you need to click into it to actually view who else is viewing the ticket.

Can we get it to display whether someone else is viewing the ticket without having to click into it? Either by:
1) Showing in the field
!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/142796i88C48AE6B97E3DE3/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!
2) Showing in this area (not sure what it's called)
!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/142797iFB433E801A0497C3/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

Not sure if this is already a feature request somewhere?

Thanks,
Dave
fields.summary: Improvement for - Who's looking addon

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

Currently, adding a service in an ITSM service project is limited to the out-of-the-box fields. It will be great to have the ability to add custom fields for s service. One example is 'version numbering' for a service.

 !Screen Shot 2021-05-13 at 10.15.06.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Abilitiy to add custom fields to a Service

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the request type configuration, you can add a description (field help) to each field added to the form. Although this field supports text formatting, the text in the portal is not rendered like the preview.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a service project > *Project settings* > *Request types*
 # Click on a Request type and select the *Request form* tab
 # Add formatted text to the *Field help* of a visible field, including a panel, borders, and colors
 # Click on *Update* and observe the preview
 # Click on *Preview form in portal*.

h3. Expected Results

The formatted description will be exactly like the configuration page.

!print.png|width=265,height=65,thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The format is broken.

!print2.png|width=264,height=66,thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

None at the moment
fields.summary: Field help formatting is broken in the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on the *Queues* option while inside the issue view https://<yoursite>.atlassian.net/browse/<issuekey> won't direct your to all your queues' options, you're required to click on *Queues* a second time to access it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an issue, and make sure that the URL is similar to https://<yoursite>.atlassian.net/browse/<issuekey>
 # Click on the *Queues* option

h3. Expected Results

You'll go to the *Queues* section and see all queues.

h3. Actual Results

 [^Queues.mov] 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clicking on Queues inside the issue view doesn't go to the queues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, all ITSM project agents able to create/edit Services in ITSM project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create permission for the Services feature.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to set permission for Create/Edit Services in ITSM project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Last Activity date not updated for users with only site access
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure JSM
 # Invite a user from the site administration screen
 # Don't grant any product access, but grant site access
 # Log in with that user
 # Create a JSM issue

This creates an Atlassian Account user that has access to the portal for JSM only, although they are not portal-only users: [Manage Jira Service Management customer accounts|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/manage-jira-service-management-customer-accounts/]
h3. Expected Results

Login/activity date should be updated in the Administration > Users screen
h3. Actual Results

*Last Activity* date just shows the date the user was created
h3. Workaround

It's possible to find this date based on the date of the most recent comment/issues created by a customer using JQL and sorting by created date. This can also be found through the database.
fields.summary: Last Activity date not updated for users with only site access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Previously at legacy Insight plugin , there's QR code feature which is not available at the new JSM Insight.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add QR code feature to JSM Insight.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Insight to have QR Code feature

fields.description:
Hi There,

it's only available to run reports about SLAs only per each Project and there's not any chance to run a report with the overall KPIs (all projects).

thanks
fields.summary: SLA Reports

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this time we cannot perform an edit action on multiple objects stored in an Insight custom field
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow branching over a setup of objects using Automation to be able to perform actions on multiple objects

h3. Woarkaround
Check if the following article helps you achieve your use case scenario [Update Insight object status to expired using automation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/update-insight-object-status-to-expired-using-automation-1072219008.html]
fields.summary: Ability to branch on Insight objects with Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we move an issue from one JSM project to another, if the Organziation field is set and that organization is not present in the destination project, the moved issue will show the organization field set however, if we view the same issue in the portal, the organziation field is empty
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a JSM with Organization value set that does not exist in any other project
 # Move this issue to another JSM project

h3. Expected Results

The moved issue should show the same value for organizations field in agent view and customer portal 
h3. Actual Results

The Organizations field has the value set in the agent view whereas it is empty in the customer portal
!image-2021-05-11-15-01-38-444.png|width=261,height=139!!image-2021-05-11-15-01-36-129.png|width=261,height=139!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Moving an issue from one JSM project to another will leave the organization field value in an inconsistent state

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, we need to upload a JSON file or a CSV file to import objects from that source:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to fetch the CSV/JSON file from an external URL with basic auth just like in Insight DC:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

Related to the feature [JSDCLOUD-9920|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9920] to allow scheduled imports if we plan to support it in the. future.
fields.summary: Ability to import CSV/JSON from URL of another REST API source

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
As per https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-request/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-request-issueidorkey-sla-get, it's only possible to retrieve SLA info for a specific request

h3. Suggested solution
Add the ability to also retrieve the SLA goal and JQL via API
fields.summary: Add the ability to retrieve SLA data via API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At the moment, when using "Schedule" trigger , for any Insight field used in the action , for example "Create Issue" or "Edit Issue" action, the action will not update the field accordingly. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create automation as below :-
 !Screen Shot 2021-05-11 at 11.20.19 am.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3. Expected Results
The Insight field updated as per IQL results.

h3. Actual Results
The field not updated.

h3. Workaround
Use a different trigger to update the Insight field.
OR If you put in a JQL that returns a single issue and then run the rule without using the issue, it will successfully add the objects.
fields.summary: Insight field not updated if use "Schedule" trigger

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Export Objects using User Friendly format while filtering with a large IQL condition results in 414 error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access an Insight Schema that has many assets(2k+ at least)
# Creates an IQL filter that has more than 1K conditions like: key in (key-1, key-2, key-3.... key-1500)
# Try to export the results in a user-friendly format.

h3. Expected Results
* Results are exported successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The export fails due to *414 Request-URI Too Long*
 
h3. Workaround
Split into batches the IQL conditions like.
 * key IN (key-1 ... key-300)
 * key IN (key-301 ... key 600)
fields.summary: Export Objects using User Friendly format while filtering with a large IQL condition results in 414 error

fields.description:
Currently, when using the API to [Request Type fields|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-servicedesk/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-servicedesk-servicedeskid-requesttype-requesttypeid-field-get] with expand=hiddenFields, the default options shown are the ones related to the *custom field settings*.

It would be helpful if we could retrieve default options of hidden fields *configured on the Request Types*.
fields.summary: Retrieve Request Type default values of hidden custom fields through API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The project and issuetype selected in the create issue are not used when resolving objects for cmdb custom fields. The triggering issue's project and issuetype are used instead.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a cmdb customfield with multiple contexts.
 # Chose an issue trigger
 # Create an issue and chose a project and issuetype different to that of the triggering issue and set up a query to fill objects in a cmdb customfield.

h3. Expected Results

Objects inside cmdb customfield respect the context of the project and issuetype selected in the create issue.
h3. Actual Results

The project and issuetype of the issue that triggered the rule is the context used not the one the user selected in the Create issue. Objects inserted into the cmdb customfield can differ from what is expected.
h3. Workaround

Only have one customfield context.
fields.summary: Creating an issue with a cmdb custom field does not respect the project and issueType chosen with respect to the cmdb customfield context but copies those of the issue trigger

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an automation is run on a schedule the query in the cmdb customfield in the create issue action will not put objects into it on creation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Choose scheduled trigger (do not input a JQL)
 # Choose create issue action and select a cmdb custom field to add
 # Put in a query you know will return object(s) and run the rule

h3. Expected Results

The issue would be created with object(s) inside its cmdb custom field
h3. Actual Results

Issue is created successfully but none of the cmdb custom fields will be set.
h3. Workaround

If you put in a JQL that returns a single issue and then run the rule without using the issue, it will successfully add the objects.
fields.summary: Using the scheduled trigger (without specifying a JQL) will not add objects to an insight customfield in the create issue action

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, admin only able to export objects from the object type page. 

h3. Suggested Solution

It will be best to be able to export the whole object schema instead of export each object type. On top of that , able to import the object schema using the object schema export file. This is applicable when user would like to import from a different Cloud instance.

h3. Workaround

Admin needs to export from object type.
fields.summary: Ability to export Insight from Object Schema

fields.description:
For some reasons we use 1 service-project for several customers and several service teams.

we create some "performance" dashboards for the service teams and for our key account managers.

the only difference in the service-desk reports is either customers or the service.

so we have to create each report separately for each service and for each customer.

eg. sla report for service hast to be created 8 times,

sla report for customer hast to be created 30 times.

also the dashboards.

our suggestion:

make it possible to define some selection criteria in dashboards or the reports - eg: time, customer/organisation/component (we us as service) ...

thanks

Andreas
fields.summary: Dashboards and Reports should be more generic and groupable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Request form description reverts to default when the Request type name is modified.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Project settings > Request types > Select a request type.
 # On the Request form, change the Request form description.
 # Edit the Request type name.

h3. Expected Results

The Request type name will be modified without affecting other fields/details.
h3. Actual Results

The Request form description is reverted to its original description.

!Screen Recording 2021-05-07 at 03.51.59 PM.gif|width=529,height=211!
h3. Workaround

Change the Request form description after changing the Request type name.
fields.summary: Request form description reverts to default when the Request type name is modified

fields.description:
h3. Description

While using automation [actions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-actions/] we can create an *Insight Object* and set its attributes. The problem is that when we have an Insight field that accepts multiple objects(see print below) we can't copy those values to an Insight attribute.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Use case

User has an onboarding process and whenever ticket reaches a specific status on their workflow they want automation rule to create a new Object on insight. This "User" object type has an attribute on Insight that supports *unlimited* references to another object type (Systems).

Something like below is not supported:
 !image-2021-05-07-11-30-21-910.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggestion

It would be nice if we could 
* Copy a list of objects to an Insight object attribute that is created via automation.
* Append Insight attributes to existing values
* Edit the Insight attributes with more than 1 value
* Edit the object type Insight attribute with more than 1 value
fields.summary: Add support for copying multiple values of Insight data using Automation

fields.description:
Hi there,

tried to solve with the community without success.

By adding ${request.status} variable in the email subject, and sending me the Test Email, it works perfectly as expected. Then, If you try to Save the changes, an error comes out: "Email subject contains an invalid variable - ${request.status}".

It would be helpful (end requested by our Support Team) to have it visible. Probably would be enough just to remove the check about that variable, or adding the variable in the list menu.

We hope to have it available soon.

Best Regards
fields.summary: Customer Email Template: adding ${request.status} variable in Subject

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight wrongly states that the object cannot be cloned
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object type and set it as inheriting and abstract
 # Create a child object type of the step 1 object type
 # Create an object in child object type and then clone it

h3. Expected Results

The object is cloned successfully.
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2021-05-07 at 5.06.39 PM.png!
h3. Workaround

If you add an attribute that is specific to the child object type the object can be cloned
fields.summary: Cloning an object in the child object type of an abstract and inheriting object type will throw error if both parent and child objecttypes have the exact same attributes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Wrong object type associated to cloned child object
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object type and set it as inheriting
 # Create a child object type of the step 1 object type
 # Create an object in child object type and then clone it

h3. Expected Results

The cloned object would be of the same object type as the object it cloned
h3. Actual Results

The cloned object was of the same object type as its parent
h3. Workaround

If you add an attribute that is specific to the child object type (even if you don't fill it in)
The clone will be placed in the correct object type.
fields.summary: Cloning an object in the child object type of an inheriting object type has wrong object type if both parent and child objecttypes have the exact same attributes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, we can only see the unresolved connected issues on the insight object view page, which is the default filter.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow using different filters on the object view page.

h3. Notes
Until this functionality is available, you can use the iqlfunction() in your Jira advanced search to filter the connected issues
It works in *basic* search:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
As well as  *advanced* search:
{noformat}
Object2 in iqlFunction("\"Name\" = DELL and objecttype=Laptop") {noformat}
fields.summary: Ability to create filters for connected issues on the Insight object view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, we can only see the unresolved connected issues on the insight object view page, which is the default filter.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow using different filters on the object view to see different
h3. Notes

Until this functionality is available, you can use the iqlfunction() in your Jira advanced search to filter the connected issues

It works in *basic* search:
[!_thumb_5961695.png|thumbnail!|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/5961695/5961695_screenshot-2.png]
And *advanced* search:
{noformat}
Object2 in iqlFunction("\"Name\" = DELL and objecttype=Laptop") {noformat}
fields.summary: Ability to create filters for connected issues on the Insight object view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Jira service desk, customers are added to multiple service projects. As an admin, it is difficult to go to each project to know which project customer has been added too.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide Overview of the customer to know which projects customer is added to in Jira service management (like view Jira project roles )

*Why this is important*

Some customers are added to more than one project. So it would be helpful to check if they have access to all projects or a few of them in the customer portal. So an overview of this would be nice. If there are a lot of customers, it is very hard to get this information manually.
fields.summary: Ability to display an overview of the customer in Jira service Management

fields.description:
Hi,

I could not see where to log an enhancement suggestion for StatusPage so please move this to the correct team.

 

Idea: It would be great to create to add additional StatusPage event type beyond "Incidents" & "Maintenance". e.g. If a team wants to alert customers about a known issue that is not impacting the platform operationally but is generating service requests this may not fall into an "Incident" bucket or a "Maintenance" bucket. If we had a customizable bucket that had the same features as the Incident feature, but we could name it whatever was appropriate to the customer that would allow a lot of flexibility.
fields.summary: [StatusPage] Suggestion

fields.description:
Provide an option to display the Confluence Space name, on the suggested articles instead of the Service Desk Portal name.

Use cases:
"As a customer of the service desk portal for several software solutions, I want to understand if suggested knowledge base articles are relevant so that I can pick up the right one.

Note that we have one Confluence space per software solution. As such, knowledge base articles belong to one and only one space."
fields.summary: Display Confluence Space name in Portal.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when you write a comment in Respond to Customer tab and switch the tab to Internal comment then Jira copies your comment to the other tab as well. This means you can either add the public comment or the internal comment but not both separate comments at the same time.
!image-2021-05-06-20-51-01-959.png|width=389,height=108!
h3. Suggested Solution

There should be functionality where the user can enter separate comments (internal and public comment) and when he hit the submit button then both the comments should be posted accordingly.
h3. Why this is important:

This is important because sometimes agents need to add separate comments for customer and internal use. 

*Wrokaround*:
Add the internal comment first from the agent view and then write the public comment from the transition screen.
fields.summary: ability to add separate internal and public comments on transition screen at the same time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the "Linked Issues" tab at the object details screen are only displaying the issue key , issue summary and priority. Below are the example screenshot :-

 !Screen Shot 2021-05-06 at 4.08.33 pm.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great to be able to add more column to the list.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to add more column at "Linked Issues" tab at insight Object Details screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when there is HTML syntax in REST API data field for [Create Customer Request|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-request/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-request-post] request , it is not rendered correctly. This is due to the field only supporting wiki style renderer. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great JSM able to automatically convert the HTML syntax to wiki style rendered when issue created via REST API

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Allow HTML syntax data in REST API request automatically change to wiki style renderer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the AWS service catalog key parameters data are not showing in the request form.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow key parameters to display at request form.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Allowing AWS key parameters added to the request form when using AWS Service Catalog connector

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Trying to export a large amount of objects with references to other object types results in a 504 HTTP error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Open an object type with a large amount of objects with references
 # Step 2: Try and export it with User Friendly format

h3. Expected Results
A .csv file should be generated and downloaded

h3. Actual Results
A 504 http error is raised and an error screen is shown to the user.

h3. Workaround
Choose "data consistent" in the Format drop down when exporting the objects.
fields.summary: Export Objects using User Friendly format results in 504 error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

After the implementation of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3334, currently, all the workflow statuses are being shown on the customer portal to filter the requests.
 There are some scenarios where customers do not want to show all the statuses to their clients. Just Open/Closed Issues filter was okay for those customers.
!image-2021-05-05-14-51-41-270.png|width=209,height=109!
h3. Suggested Solution:

It should be configurable whether you want an Open/Closed filter or want to make all the statuses visible to the clients.
  

*Why this is important:*

There are some statuses in workflow like 'escalated to tier1', 'escalated to tier2', 'checking with internal team', these statuses should not be visible in the filter to clients.
fields.summary: all statuses should not be shown in customer portal to filter the request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Recently, Jira Work Management has introduced some great business-centric features such as Calendars and Boards. It will be great to have some of these features for Service projects as there are business departments that predominantly require a customer service solution, hence the use of JSM projects, however, they will also benefit from the business features introduced in JSM internally.

h3. Suggestion
Provide the option for internal users to use the business features on a Service Management project
fields.summary: Some Jira Work Management features (Calendars, Boards) on Jira Service Management

fields.description:
Hoje temos vários campos personalizados e eles não aparecem no portal. Tem 2 locais que seria interessante essa personalização, sendo elas:

Solicitações: Onde aparece a lista de chamados.

Bilhete: Ao clicar no bilhete para ver as informações completas do chamado.

 

Caso de uso: Temos campos que são personalizados, onde registramos Valor, Esforço em Horas, Prazo em Dias. Para a entrega de um produto. E estas informações não são aparentes ao cliente devido as configurações do portal.

!image-2021-05-04-12-24-44-042.png!
fields.summary: Configurações do portal

fields.description:
The requirement is that the email integrations can break for a range of reasons, especially
when they are done with app passwords and passwords do expire. But any integration can have issues. Currently, there is a dependency on customers informing that the emails aren't being received which means, there could be delays in noticing this.

*Suggestion*

It would be helpful to get notified if the email integration fails to receive emails.
fields.summary: Alert on password expiration of email integration apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Performance issues while searching for objects by date

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a scheme with about 100 (or more) objects
 # Try performing a date search
#* No changes
 [^Screen Recording 2021-05-04 at 09.45.20 AM.mp4] 
Once you refresh the page, the filter is gone:
 !Screenshot 2021-05-04 at 09.53.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Search is updated or it displays a progress indicator

h3. Actual Results
No change on UI and search option is disabled

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Performance issues while searching for objects by date

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, for imported portfolio data, it doesn't display at the JIRA request form

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow import portfolio display in request form

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: AWS Service Catalog connector support import portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In IT service management (ITSM) projects, requests are organized into four main categories: service requests, incidents, problems, and changes. Their individual queues are filtered by the ticket category.

When an issue is moved to an ITSM project, the issue won't have a ticket category defined, therefore, it doesn't show under the categories queues, just under the normal queue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Move an issue to an ITSM project;
 # Check the issue type category queue.
 
h3. Expected Results
The issue is shown under the issue type category queue and the regular queue.

h3. Actual Results
The issue just shows under the regular queue, not the category.

h3. Workaround
Editing the request type field maps the issue to the ticket category.
fields.summary: Issues moved to ITSM projects don't have a ticket category

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User's can't switch to advanced search when no result is returned with basic

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search in an object type for several attributes until you get no results
# Try to go to advanced search
 !adv search is disabled.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Advanced search is possible
h3. Actual Results
Advanced search button is disabled

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: User's can't switch to advanced search when no result is returned with basic

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the AWS service catalog in AWS view is not the same in JIRA view. The AWS parameters are jumble up in Customer Portal.

h3. Suggested Solution
Remain the view as AWS in JIRA Customer Portal

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: AWS Service Catalog display data at JIRA view the same format as in AWS views

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, if admin would like to add multiple of phone number for customer profile , there are no options to increase the cardinality for "Text" type. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create special attribute for "Phone Number" or ability to add multiple value when using "Text" attribute type , similar as "Email address" attribute.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to add multiple value for "Text" attribute

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customizing the columns order under "Requests" in the JSM portal, doesn't work and it'll follow the order of the customize requests list, ignoring the order that was specified.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your Requests page 'https://<your instance>/servicedesk/customer/user/requests?page=1'
 # Click on the *Manage columns*
 # Order the columns by drag and drop
 # Save the configuration
 # Refresh the page

h3. Suggestion

Allow the ability to reorder the columns after saving manage columns configuration.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the columns order under "Requests" in the JSM portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Importing CSV with an invalid value in the User type attribute does not import the entire record. There is no error reported as well in the Import result. 
This works fine when invalid values are provided for other attribute types like Boolean, date, etc.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an object type with a user attribute
# Create a CSV file that with 2 records to create two objects
# Set the user attribute for the first one to an Atlassian account id that exists in the cloud site and the second one to an Atlassian account id that does not exist
# Import the CSV file 

h3. Expected Results
Objects from both the rows are created, but the 2nd object is created with an empty User attribute as the value mentioned in CSV is invalid

h3. Actual Results
Only the first row creates an object. 
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Importing CSV with an invalid value in the User type attribute does not import the entire record.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On the Customer Portal, the word "*Requests*" unfortunately directly gets translated to polish language as "Żądania". We already have a polish word like "*demand*" which sounds like "*to demand something categorically*".

Please find the screenshot with the problem areas marked attached.
!image-2021-04-30-13-18-39-852.png|width=173,height=63!


h3. Suggested Solution

1. change translation in polish language from "*Żądania*" to something else in the Customer portal for the Polish language
2. change the original text "*Requests*" to something more accurate like "*Issues*" or "*Tasks*" or "*Calls*" in *IT-oriented language*
h3. Why this is important:

It would be nice to have the keywords of IT-Oriented language like Issues or taks.
fields.summary: Update polish language translation in Service Desk Customer Portal

fields.description:
*Suggestion:*

* It would be nice to have the possibility to change the way the SHARE WITH works after the ticket is created so that it is similar to the way it works when creating the ticket in the first place (combo box with a visible list of org-project the customer is entitled to).
* it would be nice if possible to add a description to the SHARE WITH in the ticket visualization after the ticket has been created.
fields.summary: Improve 'Share with' option once the ticket is created on the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Automation rules with "Scheduled" triggers, are not being executed.
h3. Environment

Insight App (Cloud)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scheduled automation rule
# Wait for the rule to be executed

h3. Expected Results
The rule will be successfully executed

h3. Actual Results
The rule will not be executed
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround so far
fields.summary: Scheduled automation rules are not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Trying to order the columns under "Requests" in the JSM portal, by clicking *Manage columns*, doesn't work and it'll follow the order of the customize requests list, ignoring the order that was specified.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your Requests page 'https://<your instance>/servicedesk/customer/user/requests?page=1'
 # Click on the *Manage columns*
 # Order the columns by drag and drop
 # Save the configuration
 # Refresh the page 

h3. Expected Results

After ordering the columns and clicking *Done* (or *Save changes* on the customize requests list), the order should be the one you specified. 

h3. Actual Results

After saving the configuration it reverts back to the other of the fields at the customize requests list.

Video displaying the issue:

 [^manage columns .mov] 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Customizing the columns order under "Requests" in the JSM portal, doesn't work and it'll follow the order of the customize requests list

fields.description:
h3. Summary

New objects are not synced into the "Asset" custom field, even when the "Automatic synchronization" is enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an object type and populate it with a few objects.
# [Create a new Asset type configuration in Insight|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSCLOUD/How+to+add+an+asset+type+configuration].
# In Jira create a new custom field of type *Asset* and map it to the project's screens.
# Edit the custom field context to add the filter.
# Select the newly created Asset Type configuration.
# Try creating a ticket, selecting one of the objects on the customer field.

# Also for an existing asset type configuration already linked to an Asset custom field, create a new object at the Insight end and then try to browse the new object in the asset filed in the Jira issue view

h3. Expected Results

You're able to browse newly created objects

h3. Actual Results
You won't be able to browse newly created objects.


h3.Workaround
Manually sync the Asset type configuration
fields.summary: Not able to browse newly created Insight objects on the Asset field. Automatic synchronization is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight does not honor setting a date format in the Jira other than the default
h3. Expected Results

Follow the Jira date time settings
h3. Actual Results

Insight date is hardcoded to yyyy-dd-mm
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Allow Insight to inherit the Date format from Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an alert is created in Opsgenie, the alert creates a JSM ticket via JSM integration. The on-call person acknowledges the alert. 

The functionality requested here is to set the JSM ticket assignee to the person who acknowledged the alert in Opsgenie.

Additionally, whenever the person un-acknowledges the alert, it should also mark the JSM ticket as unassigned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Opsgenie alert. That creates a JSM ticket
 # Acknowledge the alert in Opsgenie

h3. Expected Results

The JSM ticket should capture the details of the person who acknowledged the alert in Opsgenie and set that user as the JSM ticket assignee.
h3. Actual Results

The information about the person who acknowledged the is not sent to JSM.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Set Jira Service Management ticket Assignee to the person who acknowledged alert in Opsgenie

fields.description:
The customer portal login page asks for the customer's e-mail address before asking for the password. Even if an e-mail address that is not associated with any existing account is entered, the customer will be prompted to insert a password. Only after entering both credentials the error message "_Sorry, your email or password are incorrect - please try again_" is displayed.
h3. Suggestion

Validate the e-mail address and display the error message before asking for the password.
fields.summary: Validation of customer e-mail address before asking for password

fields.description:
h3. Description
In Jira Server users have the option to [create reports|https://documentation.mindville.com/display/ICV85/How+to+create+a+report], so it would be nice to have a similar feature in Cloud.
fields.summary: Add the ability to run Insight Reports

fields.description:
With the change from legacy automation to the new automation there doesn't appear to be an email template to send an email. We set these up to ensure consistent formatting of all emails and just enter the content in the automation. When using the legacy automation the email template set up in Customer notifications is used (this includes content and CSS formatting). However with new automation the send email action doesn't appear to use this template. Instead the emails seem to get some mime formatting surrounding the email content and html tags (eg
) included in the email. I have set the emails to send as HTML and enabled convert line breaks to HTML line breaks. Please add usage of email templates to the send email action
fields.summary: New automation - email template is missing

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 8 October}
currentReporter() or the ${reporter} syntax is now supported
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Using in the Insight custom field Filter scope IQL "currentUser()" or "currentReporter()" doesn't work in the portal while it works in the Jira issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a custom field filter scope to include an IQL like User = currentUser()
 # Link an object in Insight to your user
 # Go to Jira issue view and try to search for objects in the custom field it will work
 # Fo to the portal and try to search for objects in the custom field

h3. Expected Results

Objects should start rendering in the list
h3. Actual Results

No results is immediately rendered
h3. Workaround

If your attribute is of type "Jira User", you should be able to use something like:

*Filter issue scope (IQL):* "Owner" = ${reporter}

Here's some documentation on setting it up: [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/configure-the-insight-object-field/]
fields.summary: Insight custom field does not honor currentReporter() and currentUser() in the portal

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update 8 October}
currentReporter() or the ${reporter} syntax is now supported
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Using currentReporter() syntax at the Insight custom field IQL filter scope are not working.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add "User" attribute in Insight object type and update with a user email address
 # Add Insight custom field and add to the project screen.
 # At Insight object field configuration , use *User = currentReporter()* IQL
 # Create issue on behalf of customer from JIRA , update the reporter with the user you've added previously at object.

h3. Expected Results

The insight field only listed value that meet the IQL filter.
h3. Actual Results

No result
h3. Workaround

If your attribute is of type "Jira User", you should be able to use something like:

*Filter issue scope (IQL):* "Owner" = ${reporter}

Here's some documentation on setting it up: [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/configure-the-insight-object-field/]
fields.summary: Using currentReporter() syntax at the Insight custom field IQL filter scope are not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When [linking a Confluence space to a service project|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/link-confluence-spaces-to-your-service-project/], customers from the project will be able to view the space directly in Confluence if they have an Atlassian account.

When another project is linked to a different space, customers from a different project that is also integrated with other Confluence spaces will be able to view it when accessing Confluence, even though they are not customers of the project(s) in question.

(i) Spaces [open for the public|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/] will also be visible to these customers even if the [Global permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/manage-global-permissions/] are not open for the public.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Create three spaces in Confluence|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-a-blank-space/].
 # Set one of the spaces to [have public access enabled|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/set-up-public-access/].
 # Once the spaces are created, create [two Service Management projects|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-management/resources/get-started-guide].
 # [Link the projects with the different spaces not open for the public|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/link-confluence-spaces-to-your-service-project/] (I.E. project A with space A and project B with space B).
 ## (i) The viewing permissions should be *Restricted* (so the customer can view the space in Confluence).
 # Have at least one [customer account|https://support.atlassian.com/user-management/docs/manage-jira-service-management-customer-accounts/] (with an [Atlassian account|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/what-is-an-atlassian-account/], but no product access).
 # Under Project A, [add the account as a Jira Service Management customer|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/add-a-customer-to-a-service-project/].
 # Have the user accessing Confluence.

h3. Expected Results

The customers should only be able to view the space linked to the project where they are a customer.
h3. Actual Results

The customers can view and access any spaces linked to Jira Service Management projects or with public access enabled.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Customers can view spaces linked to other JSM projects or opened to the public

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Select list fields are not highlighted when clicking on “Send” if there are more than one required field.

If only the Summary is required, then the fields are highlighted.

 When the summary + description (or other fields) are required, if the customer clicks on “Send” the fields won’t be highlighted when they click on Send, it will only be highlighted after filling other fields.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add required fields on a request form.
 # Also add Select list custom fields as required.
 # Try to create a ticket via portal without filling all required fields.

h3. Expected Results

If the customer clicks on “Send” it will highlight all the required fields that they didn’t fill. 
h3. Actual Results

It doesn’t highlight Select list fields.

!Screen Recording 2021-04-27 at 05.16.52 PM.gif|width=308,height=311!
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Select list custom fields not highlighted in the portal when set as Required

fields.description:
As an automation designer,
I would like the ability to create an automation that uses the "Branch Rule" component wherein I specify an IQL (as I can with "JQL"),
So that I can update the status (or other attribute) of multiple related Insight Objects during a customer reported outage or other event that would cause the need to bubble up information to other Insight Objects so that others can see potential root cause relationships within the objects.
fields.summary: Automation "Branch Rule" for Insight IQL results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The mail handler is throwing the below error:
{quote}The server selected protocol version TLS10 is not accepted by client preferences [TLS12]
{quote}
JSM Cloud will not connect to the TLS1.0 configured mail server as per the document [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Deprecating-TLSv1-and-TLSv1-1-for-Atlassian-Cloud-Products/ba-p/857357]. But the mail server is not on TLS1.0. Customers who had already configured the Mail Handlers are seeing Rate_Limited connection status.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Check the custom incoming email handler of the JSM project
h3. Expected Results

Mail handler to connect without exceptions
h3. Actual Results

Getting TLS exceptions

!image (3).png|width=550,height=229!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mail handler throwing "The server selected protocol version TLS10 is not accepted by client preferences [TLS12]" error

fields.description:
Hello there i have a suggestion. 
On our Server instance we are using Customer Objects in Insight which are referenced with the type Project to our Customer Projects.
These Projects have a special Service Desk Project as well. 

As you merge all 3 Functions together to your Service Management Premium i'll want to suggest to do this mapping for us. 

When we create a Project it would be nice we also Create a Customer in an Object Sheme in Insight. 
Get in touch with the employees of our Customers, it would be nice to get these as Persons in Insight as well. So we can store more information or even connect them to Assets.
Maybe when you add a new email to an organisation this will create a person with the given email as attribute.

For your business you can handle this as a Service desk object sheme in Insight where you manage to built this without every knowledge of our object sheme. So we can acess the data or expand these as we like.

I hope it is understandable what i suggest. Till then i am creating redundance Objects to match the requirements. 

Thanks,
H.Schumacher
fields.summary: Merge Features to Upgrade Jira Service Management

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, admin doesn't have visibility about the import error logs when there's error occured during import. Below are the current view :-

 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 10.57.54 am.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great to allow admin to have visibility on the import error logs

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability for Insight Admin to get the error logs when doing import

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, it is not possible to schedule Insight Import to execute the import.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be great to have the options and will allow admin to plan when the import should be executed.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to schedule Insight Import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Recently, there's a changes on how the attachment button worked. When clicking the "Add Attachment" button as per screenshot below , it only add to the Attachment panel , but not to the comment section :-

 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 8.48.42 am.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open issue in JIRA
 # Click the "Add Attachment" button and upload an image

h3. Expected Results
It automatically added to the comment section and share to the customer. 

h3. Actual Results
It only added to the attachment panel and agent need to manually add to the comment section to share to customer.

h3. Workaround

Click the *Files & Image* button in the comment section and upload the attachment. By doing so , it will automatically added to comment section :-

 !Screen Shot 2021-04-27 at 8.52.27 am.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add attachment are not added to comment section automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Service Management Cloud*. Using *Jira Service Management Server/Data Center*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-5034].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

It's possible to [transition|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/server/#servicedeskapi/request/\{issueIdOrKey}/transition-performCustomerTransition] a request via REST API and also to [add an internal comment|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/server/#servicedeskapi/request/\{issueIdOrKey}/comment] via REST API.

However, it's not possible to transition *and* add an internal comment in the same call
h3. Suggestion

Make it possible to transition and add an internal comment in the same REST API call
fields.summary: Transition and add internal comment via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight Object Search does not search past the first 50 objects during workflow transitions
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have an object type with more than 50 objects
 # Create an Insight Field and configure it to that Object Type
 # Add that field to a transition
 # Execute the transition and search for any object after the first 50 OR on the issue Create screen, search for any object after the first 50 objects

h3. Expected Results

The object is properly returned
h3. Actual Results

No matches are found
h3. Workaround

Add the field to the View and Edit screen operations and edit it outside of the transition. 
The object search also works fine from the customer portal.
fields.summary: Insight Object Search does not search past the first 50 objects during workflow transitions and on Issue Create screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the Customer Portal, it says "*Raised this on Today 08:22 PM*" even the date is Today, while it should say "Raised this *Today* at 08:22 PM". Its German translation also says '*am Heute'* while it should be '*heute*' only. Please check the Portal screenshot below:

!image-2021-04-26-20-22-54-896.png|width=231,height=113!    !image-2021-04-26-20-25-25-368.png|width=219,height=95!

 

Similarly, the content in the sign-up email will look better if updated as follows:

!image-2021-04-26-20-32-44-047.png|width=409,height=287!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any ticket and check in the portal when the issue is created
 # For second screenshot, send a registration email to your email address and change your profile language to German

h3. Expected Results
h3. !image-2021-04-26-20-35-58-467.png|width=150,height=105!  and  !image-2021-04-26-20-25-25-368.png|width=219,height=95!
Actual Results
h3. !image-2021-04-26-20-22-54-896.png|width=231,height=113!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: German Language notification and date representation on the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding a valid user as a participant to a request throws error
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to request details
 # Click Share
 # Add user
 # Save
 # Error will be shown

h3. Expected Results

Request should be shared with the user.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"An error occurred while validating request participants"}],"reasonKey":"sd.request.participants.error.field.validate.failed","reasonCode":"400"}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

There's no workaround right now.
fields.summary: Adding a valid user as a participant to a request throws error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there's no public API to retrieve emails. The only possible option is to manually download it from the processing logs
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a REST API to retrieve the emails
h3. Why this is important

To automate this process and use the API programmatically so that admins will not need to do it manually each day.
fields.summary: Public REST API to retrieve email(Issue creation/commented) from the Connection/Processing logs

fields.description:
h3. Problem

While using a next-gen project, it isn't possible to set a property to the status to, eg: disable comments when in Closed status.

h3. Suggested resolution

Add workflow properties to enable more functions to the workflow
fields.summary: Add workflow properties to enable more functions to the workflow
Return affected services  Name and Tier on GET issue API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Object search on Issue create action from Jira returns incomplete results 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Insight object and configure it to display objects. Add two objects to it, book and phonebook
# In Create issue operation, try to search for objects using the string *book*

h3. Expected Results
The objects book and phone book both should be returned

h3. Actual Results
Only the object book is retruned
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

The object search works fine on Edit action and the customer portal:
Edit operation
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
Portal
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Add the objects after the issue is created
fields.summary: Object search on Issue create action from Jira returns incomplete results

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Graph View does not respect Reference Depth

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Structure where Object A is referencing object B which references Object C
# Open the Object Graph for Object A - make sure the Reference Depth is set to 1

h3. Expected Results
Graph shows Object A is referencing Object B

h3. Actual Results
Graph shows Object A is referencing Object B which is referencing Object C
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround at this time
fields.summary: Graph View does not respect Reference Depth

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, we can only run an IQL against individual object types and their children using [objectTypeAndChildren() function|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/use-insight-query-language-iql/#Using-the-objectTypeAndChildren---function]
h3. Suggested Solution

Just like the Insight server, it would be good to have the global IQL search, that allows running an IQL against all object types in an object schema
fields.summary: Ability to perform IQL search across all object types in an object schema

fields.description:
h2. Problem definition
When a customer accesses an article via the customer portal, they will see an *Edit file* button on attachments. Currently, it is not possible to remove/hide this button.

h2. Suggested solution
Add an option to disable/hide the *Edit file* button.
fields.summary: Remove Edit file from attachments in Customer Portal.

fields.description:
it would be super cool to have checklists in problem description or comments sections

this would allow to create small tasks for tickets
fields.summary: Add checklist to comments or problem description

fields.description:
Currently, If you modify the *Viewing Permissions* of a *Space* *linked* in a *Project*, it will also modify the *Viewing Permissions* of the same Space in all the other Projects where it was linked to, that is how the product is supposed to behave since it updates the permissions directly on the Confluence, and not in the Projects.

It would be nice to have an option to remove this inheritance of the Confluence permissions, so the Projects could have separated Viewing Permissions.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I want to set Viewing Permissions of a space per Project

fields.description:
h3. iIssue Summary
 * Customer view of filtered issues displaying incorrectly after hitting "*Back*" button of the browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Make a filter selection for any status
 !image-2021-04-22-20-00-48-509.png|width=322,height=129!
 # Open any ticket by clicking on *Summary* or *Issue Key*
 # Hit the back button, you would see that filter selection is still there but the results are not correct
 !image-2021-04-22-19-59-17-190.png|width=356,height=170!
 # Hit the refresh button and it will again show you the correct results
 !image-2021-04-22-20-01-07-233.png|width=351,height=131!
 check the video here : [^filter results in SD Portal.mov]

h3. Expected Results

After hitting the '*back*' button, JIRA should show the filtered results as per the selection done above in filters
h3. Actual Results

It shows all the results and just ignores the filter
h3. Workaround

Hit the refresh button manually again
fields.summary: Customer view of filtered issues displaying incorrectly after hitting "Back" button of the browser

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On ITSM service projects, it's possible to add and configure services one by one. As an Admin, I would like the ability to bulk upload and configure services in a project.
h3. Suggested Solution

Give Admins the ability to bulk upload/configure services in an ITSM service project - either by CSV upload or via REST API.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk upload and configure services in ITSM projects

fields.description:
*Summary*

At the moment, it's only possible to set the *HTML email parsing* for the entire JSM Configuration:

  !image-2021-04-21-16-37-20-840.png|thumbnail! 

*Suggestion*

It would be great to have the ability to set the *HTML email parsing* on each JSM Mail Handler or per Service Project.
fields.summary: As an Admin I want to set the "HTML email parsing" configuration per Service Project or Mail Handler

fields.description:
h3. Summary
IQL fails to execute when comparing a single word that contains a reserved keyword and prevets any bulk action to be performed on the results returned

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Text type attribute to an object type
# Create an object with Text attribute set as *empty_placeholder*
# Run the below IQL and try to perform a bulk action on the results returned, like bulk delete:
{noformat}
"Name" = "empty_placeholder"
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
Able to execute the IQL and perform bulk action on the results returned

h3. Actual Results
As soon as you execute the query first time, it executes successfully and changes the IQL to as follows, double quotes are removed since it is a single word:
{noformat}
"Name" = empty_placeholder
{noformat}
Now when you will try to run the same IQL again OR try to perform a bulk action on the results returned, the following error is reported:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
For single words avoid using the reserved keywords or use more than one word hen using a  reserved keyword
fields.summary: IQL fails to execute when comparing a single word that contains a reserved keyword

fields.description: As a customer I would like to have the ability to filter by portal group on the requests overview (My Requests, All Requests) as filtering by request type is confusing if there are a lot of request types.
fields.summary: Filter by "portal group" in requests overview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an image(.png/.jpeg for example) are added in the comment, the notification triggered will contain the below text instead of rendering the image
{code:java}
!image-20210407-xxxx (xxxx).png|width=1279,height=342!{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment with an image file
 # Receive a notification with the above format

+*Note:*+

This is not reproducible on all cloud sites.
h3. Expected Results

Image is rendered as the Global settings for email is HTML format
h3. Actual Results

The image is not rendered.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Images are not rendered correctly in Jira/Customer Notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Not able to load the Insight object on issue view, it prevents users from selecting an object
{quote}There was a problem loading the Insight objects. Please refresh the page to try again.
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight object and configure the objects field configuration with schema and Filter scope information
 # Add the field to the issue screen

h3. Expected Results
Users are able to browse for objects from the schema selected in the object field configuration

h3. Actual Results
Insight object field reports and error on issue view and prevents users from selecting an object
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
No workaround at this time
fields.summary: Not able to load the Insight object on issue view "There was a problem loading the Insight objects"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, it is not possible to maintain the same object key when importing from Insight add on to JSM Insight Cloud. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best there's option to remain the same object key

h3. Workaround 
Create an attribute in JSM Insight Cloud and insert the old object key data.
fields.summary: Ability to maintain the same object key when import from add on to JSM Insight Cloud

fields.description:
Connect a JSM to AWS to make regular checks on infrastructure and import configuration data about my infrastructure.

Atlassian has Insight to : [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1218757/insight-aws-integration?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview]
But this plugin is only available for Server.

Also Atlassian has an integration in Opsgenie and AWS which can be used as a model. 




Currently, we do not support any integration in Insight. We only support CSV Import.
fields.summary: AWS Integration for Insight Cloud
